intro: Leucadendron decurrens, commonly known as the silver leaf cycad, is a member of the Proteaceae family native to South Africa. It is characterized by its tall, unbranched stem and large, strap-shaped leaves that are often covered in a silvery-white powdery coating. The plant produces striking cone-like inflorescences that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and slow growth rate, it is a popular ornamental plant in gardens and collections.
